2.formula:
Hypernumbers is ideal for businesses that:
- just need a display site
- need to knit together Facebook, Twitter and other web stuff
- need simple forms that people can use to contact them
- need to update their site regularly
- don't want the hassle and cost of dealing with techies
- need to share spreadsheet-like data securely and easily
- want to take simple payments online

Hypernumbers does not currently have a mature e-commerce offering which supports shopping carts, etc, etc
2.value:

- just need a display site
- need to knit together Facebook, Twitter and other web stuff
- need simple forms that people can use to contact them
- need to update their site regularly
- don't want the hassle and cost of dealing with techies
- need to share spreadsheet-like data securely and easily
- want to take simple payments online

Hypernumbers does not currently have a mature e-commerce offering which supports shopping carts, etc, etc

2.formula: Because Hypernumbers is a complete web development environment you can build rich user questionaires with embedded video and images. You can rerun surveys again and again and keep the data together, and do side by side comparisons on the results, as well as inline processing of the results.
2.value: Because Hypernumbers is a complete web development environment you can build rich user questionaires with embedded video and images. You can rerun surveys again and again and keep the data together, and do side by side comparisons on the results, as well as inline processing of the results.

2.formula:
It is probably not for you, as you can use other technologies to do the same things. But there are some specialist uses (media rich questionnaires, wireframes) where you might find it useful.
Where it is really useful for technical people is getting their non-technical friends and relatives off their backs :) It is ideal for offloading tech duties onto non-technical sisters and brothers!
2.value:
It is probably not for you, as you can use other technologies to do the same things. But there are some specialist uses (media rich questionnaires, wireframes) where you might find it useful.
Where it is really useful for technical people is getting their non-technical friends and relatives off their backs :) It is ideal for offloading tech duties onto non-technical sisters and brothers!

2.formula:
you can build a quick form simply by selecting a range of cells and right-clicking. On the right-click menu is a quick form option.
For more sophisticated forms you can use the form element buttons at the right-hand side of the toolbar.
For super-advanced stuff - read the documentation.
2.value:
you can build a quick form simply by selecting a range of cells and right-clicking. On the right-click menu is a quick form option.
For more sophisticated forms you can use the form element buttons at the right-hand side of the toolbar.

2.formula:
You can put almost any HTML into a Hypernumbers cell. So whenever a site offers an 'embed' option (sometimes they use the '</>' icon you can try and embed it in your spreadsheet.
From time to time this will go horribly wrong - when it does get in touch and we will rush to fix it :) Try and change the YouTube video below...
